definition: to win an election/to get a position by passing the imperial exam
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: She took a passage from a novel.
sentences.chinese: 她從一本小說中選了一段。

sentences.english: You can have only one dessert, so please decide between cake and ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 你只能有一份甜點，請在蛋糕和冰激凌中選一個。

sentences.english: We recommend that you choose a set meal from the various dishes on this menu.
sentences.chinese: 我們建議您從菜單上的各種菜品中選一款套餐。

sentences.english: Because studies show that the deeper the voice, the more electable the candidate.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明，候選人的聲音越低沉，中選機率越大。

sentences.english: Best of all, every program on this list is free.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，列在我們清單上的軟件算是優中選優了。

sentences.english: The 1948 non-elected national secretary of the Youth Union.
sentences.chinese: 1948年中選爲非國大青年聯盟全國書記。

sentences.english: I liked to walk up Fifth Avenue and pick out romantic women from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡在五號路上蹓躂，在人羣中選挑風流的女人。

sentences.english: We have two salespersons to choose from.
sentences.chinese: 我們要從2個產品銷售者中選一個。

sentences.english: In 2002, Ronaldo was selected as Mr Football of the World" ."
sentences.chinese: 在2002年，羅老師中選爲足球天下文化”。

sentences.english: Select someone from your team that can pull very far.
sentences.chinese: 從你的隊伍中選一個可以發盤很遠的人。

sentences.english: He closed his eyes and chose random people from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他閉上眼睛隨機從人羣中選了幾個人。

sentences.english: Users select a form from the menu.
sentences.chinese: 用戶從菜單中選擇一個表單。

definition: to compete/to take part in a competition
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
carefully chosen/handpicked/best of the bunch/choice (product)/concentration (mining)/to concentrate/to winnow
